thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Understanding & Scoping (1/12): Objective is to let multiple agents share a session’s thought history without blowing context or echoing their own thoughts back. Requirements: (a) add per-agent badgeId; (b) show previous thoughts on arrival, defaulting to last 100 for a new badge, fewer (e.g., 5) for returning; (c) allow caller to request N via a flag; (d) exclude the caller’s own prior thoughts in the briefing; (e) keep the main JSON output clean; (f) preserve existing wrapper behavior; (g) later add multi-session support (separate state files) and a way to request full briefings or summaries.

══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Understanding & Scoping (1/12): Objective is to let multiple agents share a session’s thought history without blowing context or echoing their own thoughts back. Requirements: (a) add per-agent badgeId; (b) show previous thoughts on arrival, defaulting to last 100 for a new badge, fewer (e.g., 5) for returning; (c) allow caller to request N via a flag; (d) exclude the caller’s own prior thoughts in the briefing; (e) keep the main JSON output clean; (f) preserve existing wrapper behavior; (g) later add multi-session support (separate state files) and a way to request full briefings or summaries.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Understanding & Scoping (2/12): Constraints and success criteria. Constraints: must not pollute stdout JSON; must not re-show caller’s own prior thoughts; must keep briefings bounded and controllable; must remain non-interactive; must work with arbitrary multiline text. Success: agents see relevant prior team context on entry, can request more/less, and their own thoughts don’t get echoed back.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Exploration & Options (3/12): Briefing strategies: (A) Always show last N (configurable); (B) Adaptive: 100 for first time a badge joins, 5 afterward; (C) Summary + last M; (D) “Delta since your last visit” for returning badges; (E) On-demand paging via flags. Initial pick: (B) now, with (C) and (D) as follow-ups.

metadata.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Initial pick: (B) now, with (C) and (D) as follow-ups.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Exploration & Options (4/12): Session management alternatives: (I) Single state file (current); (II) Session IDs in filename; (III) --session-id flag to specify which file; (IV) Automatic detection based on topic fingerprint; (V) Nested folders by date/project. Pick: (III), with automatic ID generation if not specified.

metadata.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Exploration & Options (4/12): Session management alternatives: (I) Single state file (current); (II) Session IDs in filename; (III) --session-id flag to specify which file; (IV) Automatic detection based on topic fingerprint; (V) Nested folders by date/project. Pick: (III), with automatic ID generation if not specified.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Decision & Structure (5/12): Primary implementation path: (1) Add --badge-id and --show-last flags to CLI; (2) Track participants in state dict; (3) Filter briefing to exclude caller's badge_id; (4) Default to 100 thoughts for new badges, 5 for returning; (5) Print briefing to stderr with badge attribution; (6) Store badge_id in each thought_entry. Session management deferred to later phase.

metadata.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Decision & Structure (5/12): Primary implementation path: (1) Add --badge-id and --show-last flags to CLI; (2) Track participants in state dict; (3) Filter briefing to exclude caller's badge_id; (4) Default to 100 thoughts for new badges, 5 for returning; (5) Print briefing to stderr with badge attribution; (6) Store badge_id in each thought_entry. Session management deferred to later phase.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Decision & Structure (6/12): Data model changes: state.participants: { badgeId: { first_seen_at, thoughts_authored } }. thought_entry adds badge_id and keeps metadata. Briefing pipeline: load state -> compute is_new_badge -> decide show_last -> filter out entries with same badge_id -> print last N with attribution (stderr) -> proceed.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Development & Detailing (7/12): CLI: add --badge-id (string, e.g., 4 chars) and --show-last (int, 0 to suppress). Logic: if show_last is None, set to 100 if new badge, else 5. When printing briefing, compute filtered_history = [t for t in thought_history if t.badge_id != this badge]; show last show_last items with author badge in parentheses.

When printing briefing, compute filtered_history = [t for t in thought_history if t.badge_id != this badge]; show last show_last items with author badge in parentheses.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Development & Detailing (8/12): Output hygiene: print briefing to stderr only; keep stdout as the server JSON. For very large histories, we’ll rely on the show_last cap and caller override. Later, add a --no-briefing flag and a summarization mode to compress older items.

metadata.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Development & Detailing (8/12): Output hygiene: print briefing to stderr only; keep stdout as the server JSON. For very large histories, we’ll rely on the show_last cap and caller override. Later, add a --no-briefing flag and a summarization mode to compress older items.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Challenge & Response (9/12): Potential issues: (1) Broken pipe with huge outputs—mitigated by limiting show_last and using stderr; (2) Badge collision—4-char IDs are sufficiently unique in practice; (3) State file corruption—existing JSON load/save; (4) Missing badge_id in old thoughts—handle gracefully with 'unknown' label.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Challenge & Response (10/12): Do not leak massive history into the model’s context. Default show_last for new badges at 100, but allow caller override via --show-last. Add a future --no-briefing flag for workflows that want zero injection. Consider a summarizer step later for >500 thoughts.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Validation & Readiness (12/12): Complete solution enables team collaboration without context pollution. Agents identify via badge, see relevant prior work on entry (filtered, controllable), and avoid re-echoing their own thoughts. Next phases: multi-session support, summarization, and delta-since-last-visit modes. Ready for deployment.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Validation probe: As a different badge joining this session, I should see a briefing of prior thoughts authored by others, not my own, defaulting to the last 100 (12 available). Then this thought should be recorded as mine (badge XY02).

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Session Management Planning (XY02): For session IDs, we need: (1) --session-id flag to specify which conversation/project, (2) if not provided, auto-generate a short ID like "sess-1234", (3) state files named like "sequential_thinking_state_{session_id}.json", (4) maybe a sessions registry file to track active sessions with descriptions.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Session ID Implementation Details (MB01 returning): Good point from XY02. We should use STATE_DIR + session_id to build filepath. Also need --list-sessions command to show available sessions with metadata. Default behavior without --session-id: check for "default" session, else create new numbered session.

metadata.thought:

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Session Registry Design (XY02 again): Yes MB01! Registry file could be JSON with: {session_id: {description, created_at, last_modified, participant_count, thought_count}}. This helps users pick the right session to rejoin. Maybe also add --new-session flag to force creating a fresh one even if default exists.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Migration Path (MB01): When implementing sessions, preserve backward compatibility - if no --session-id given and old single state file exists, migrate it to "default" session. Print migration notice. This avoids losing existing 500+ thought histories.

thought_history.thought:
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
New Team Member Joining (ZZ03): As a brand new badge, I should see the last 20 thoughts (overriding default 100). For sessions, I agree with the migration strategy. Also suggest: session descriptions should be settable via --describe "Working on X" when creating or joining a session.
